title: What were the advantages of Soviet planes over the Luftwaffe? - Quora

response.answer_text: Equal performance, and more of them. The Russians built six aircraft for every aircraft the Germans produced. The Russians concentrated on fighters and ground attack aircraft. After 1943 and the losses at Kursk, the German Luftwaffe concentrated on attempting to stop the Western Allied bombing offensive on Germany itself. In 1944 the Soviets has almost undisputed air superiority over the front lines. By 1945 and the Battle of Berlin, the Luftwaffe was spent, and what aircraft it had were usually on the ground with no fuel. The Allies had complete mastery of the air over Germany
Sheer numbers - pilots and aircraft; Germany lost too many of their front line pilots and aircraft fighting a 2-front war that they were neither prepared for nor could execute effectively.
